name: Canyon Hotels & Resorts Boracay
detail: I highly recommend it and look forward to returning!

name: Fairways and Bluewater Boracay
detail: We rented a kayak suggested by the staff at the savoy hotel side of the beach the sister company of fairways. The paddle broke midway without hitting any rocks. We were at the deep part of the water. Our safety had been compromised and the manager made us pay 5000 pesos for the paddle even though it wasn't our fault. The manager robbie and his people were very rude talking to us as if we were criminals. Never in my life have I been treated like this in any of the hotels I have stayed. The manager also insisted that he wanted cash and credit card was not allowed . We were suspicious so we only told him we will pay in card only and he got angry. In the end it was resolved by another manager which allowed us to pay in credit card and lower the amount to 5000 which is still very high(original amount asking is 6000). Very scam worthy. Would not recommend to anyone ever

name: Boracay Ocean Club Beach Resort
detail: Boracay is definitely a great place for a short honeymoon, or a beach holiday. The people are all super friendly and both my husband and I enjoyed ourselves. The Ocean Club was by far one of the best resorts located along the quieter side of the beach in Boracay. Free beach towels and beach chairs for uninterrupted and peaceful sunset viewing. Although walking back from the main parts of the beach might be a long way, but we always enjoyed these walks along the stretch of beautiful beach. The resort itself was super clean and the staff are all wonderful. Super polite and efficient. Buffet Dinners are the best !!!! BBQ menus are wonderful, and super affordable. The Breakfast spread is also very delectable, I particularly loved that the restaurant set up an egg station. LOVED IT. The resort also can help arrange for transportation (with Island Star or Southwest), from Kalibo Airport at a good price. Other than that! My husband and I are looking forward to go back to Boracay, and we will definitely be staying at The Ocean Club!

name: Mandarin Bay Resort & Spa
detail: Mandarin Hotel really knows how to make guests feel special.

name: La Carmela de Boracay Hotel
detail: Perfect location with easy access to local attractions.

name: Happiness Hostel Boracay
detail: Staff are nice and had fun with the events that they planned

name: Shore Time Dormitel
detail: The staff were super friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The balcony was decorated with bamboo chairs and table. I wanted to cook the rice and then the staff just cooked for me and made it into three really cute cup shape. They also provide hot shower, toiletry and towel. The best Iâ€™ve ever stayed
area: Barangay Manoc-Manoc,Boracay Island - View on map

name: Aqua Boracay
detail: Been to boracay several times before and had some problem/issues with previous hotels weâ€™d stayed thatâ€™s why thereâ€™s hesitation going back... but still we want to see the new boracay after rehabilitation, and found this new hotel.... very friendly receptionist and all the staff, so helpful with our queries and accommodating with our requests.... my nieces and nephew loves it so much, saying the best hotel theyâ€™ve stayed in boracay... only the con, no service/shuttle going to dmall(though you can walk going there, almost half km) but they are working on it since they are only in soft opening... nice ambiance, spacious room, great facilities and services, and of course the kids love the pool and the beach (low tide in the afternoon, so enjoying it in the morning)... special mention to Ms Joy, Ms Jessa and Mr Marc (receptionists) and our room housekeeper Razel - kudos to them for making us at home. Til our next stay ;)
area: Bulabog Beach,Boracay Island - View on map

name: Ferra Hotel and Garden Suites
detail: My husband and I went to Boracay for my birthday celebration and we both enjoyed our stay in Ferra. Itâ€™s just about 7mins walk going to the beach and alot of establishments are just within the vicinity of the hotel which is very convenient. Dmall is just about 5 mins walk and there are banks/ATM and fastfoods and other restaurants. All their staff are polite, very accomodating and responds to our queries right away. We arrived in the hotel around 12:30pm and they offered us a refreshing complementary drinks. But, we had to wait until 2pm for check in time since our room is not yet ready. All of them greets their guests with a big smile even their guard. Upon checking in I was suprised that the room they provided us with bigger one, cause I booked for deluxe queen and fortunately we have the king size room equipped with bathtub. In terms of cleanliness, everything is clean and they change the linens when we requested for it. Clean towels are provided everyday as well. One problem we encountered is the wifi connection. We had to call the reception just so we can connect everytime, I dunno whatâ€™s wrong, but ones weâ€™re connected the internet speed is okay. The breakfast buffet is also great, i loved their beef tapas. ðŸ˜Š Our flight going back is 8:20am so we had to leave early and they provided us with packed sandwich and a bottle of water. Thank you ferra! We will be back definitely!
area: Bulabog Beach,Boracay Island - View on map

name: Paradise Garden Resort Hotel and Convention Center Boracay
detail: The Paradise Garden Resort Hotel is perfectly positioned between Station 2 and Station 3 on Boracay Island. The resort is quite big and runs from the street front to the Beach making it only 30-40meters from the water. Most of the hotels have a beach frontage which is a must when selecting a property in Boracay. The hotel has a wonderful restaurant on the beach front which is were you have your breakfast. Breakfasts cater more for the Chinese and Korean palate rather than westerners but lunch and dinners are great, especially the lunch buffet ($US12-13) which includes unlimited beers at that price. It has two pool areas and you can always find a banana chair most times of the day. From the hotel you come out on the beach side and walk along the sand to a really good selection of bars and restaurants where you can find dining options ranging from $10/person to as expensive as $50/person. You can get even cheaper in the traditional Philippino restaurants if your game LOL.
